info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 9:25AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...BURSTS OF LAKE EFFECT SNOW THIS MORNING... WEATHER... * Bursts of lake effect snow continue moving in from Lake Huron during the morning. Bands have become more organized during the early morning while migrating northward from Port Huron. The greatest concentration of activity during the rest of the morning is expected from Lexington to Port Sanilac to Forester extending inland across Sanilac county. * Snow accumulations of up to 3 inches are expected near the Lake Huron shoreline during the late morning into early afternoon. IMPACTS... * Low visibility and sudden visibility changes for motorists along with hazardous conditions on untreated roads. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
